info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 5 at 8:33AM EDT until August 5 at 10:30AM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Fairfield, Lexington and Richland.
* WHEN...Until 1030 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 833 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Irmo, Ballentine, Jenkinsville, Chapin, White Rock, Lighthouse Marina, Lake Murray Marina, Melvin Park, Pine Island, Putnam's Landing and Rocky Point Recreation Area. - This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 90 and 99. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don't drown.
Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Fairfield, SC; Lexington, SC; Richland, SC
